fashion.Overview: A feminine fashion inspired by Victorian and Rococo styles, featuring frills, lace, and petticoats.
fashion.title: Lolita
fashion.origins: Originated in Japan in the 1980s, influenced by Victorian and Rococo European styles.
fashion.styleBasics: Frilly dresses, petticoats, lace gloves, bonnets.

fashion.Overview: A casual and princess-like style with soft colors and girly silhouettes, often inspired by fairy tales.
fashion.title: Himekaji
fashion.origins: Emerged in Japan in the early 2000s as a toned-down version of Hime Gyaru.
fashion.styleBasics: Soft pastel colors, floral prints, flowy skirts, girly accessories.

fashion.Overview: A glamorous and over-the-top gyaru style featuring tiaras, big hair, and lots of pink.
fashion.title: Hime Gyaru
fashion.origins: Developed from the Gyaru subculture in the 1990s, influenced by Western princess aesthetics.
fashion.styleBasics: Big curls, tiaras, pink tones, extravagant dresses.

fashion.Overview: A stylish, feminine look popular among young office ladies and women in their 20s, focused on classy, elegant clothing worn for socializing or work.
fashion.title: Ryousangata
fashion.origins: Originated in Japan in the early 2010s as a go-to style for fashionable yet practical office wear, blending formal and casual elements.
fashion.styleBasics: Tailored blazers, pencil skirts, feminine blouses, neutral or pastel tones, often accessorized with designer handbags and heels.

fashion.Overview: A bright and colorful fashion inspired by decora and Harajuku street style, featuring layers and accessories.
fashion.title: Fairy Kei
fashion.origins: Popularized in Harajuku in the 2000s, mixing pastel colors and '80s nostalgia.
fashion.styleBasics: Layered pastel clothes, plastic accessories, toy-inspired jewelry.

fashion.Overview: A substyle of Lolita that mixes masculine and feminine elements with tailored jackets and waistcoats.
fashion.title: Ouji
fashion.origins: Emerged as a counterpart to Lolita in the 1990s in Japan.
fashion.styleBasics: Tailored shorts, waistcoats, knee-high socks, lace-up shoes.

fashion.Overview: A bold, glamorous fashion featuring heavy makeup, tanned skin, and dramatic clothing.
fashion.title: Gyaru
fashion.origins: Emerged in the 1990s in Japan as a rebellion against traditional beauty standards.
fashion.styleBasics: Bleached hair, fake tans, bold eye makeup, revealing clothing.

fashion.Overview: A darker, more elegant variation of Gyaru that combines gothic elements with feminine glam.
fashion.title: Agejo
fashion.origins: Born from hostess club fashion in the early 2000s, incorporating sexy and dark elements.
fashion.styleBasics: Tight dresses, dark makeup, voluminous hairstyles, heels.

fashion.Overview: A casual, street-style subculture that mixes Western clothing with Japanese street fashion.
fashion.title: Amekaji
fashion.origins: Influenced by American casual fashion and adapted to Harajuku street style in the 1990s.
fashion.styleBasics: Denim jackets, varsity jackets, sneakers, graphic tees.

fashion.Overview: A style based on the traditional uniforms worn by students in Japan, but with a fashionable twist.
fashion.title: Seifuku Kei
fashion.origins: Inspired by school uniforms and adapted into street fashion in the 2000s.
fashion.styleBasics: Pleated skirts, blazers, ties, loafers.

fashion.Overview: A futuristic, sci-fi-inspired fashion using metallic colors and sleek designs to create a modern look.
fashion.title: Cyber Kei
fashion.origins: Emerged in the late 1990s, influenced by sci-fi media and rave culture.
fashion.styleBasics: Neon colors, metallic fabrics, platform boots, tech accessories.

fashion.Overview: A natural and earthy fashion with soft, muted tones and flowing, relaxed silhouettes.
fashion.title: Mori Kei
fashion.origins: Emerged in the 2000s as an alternative to flashy street fashion, inspired by nature.
fashion.styleBasics: Earth tones, loose layers, natural fabrics, vintage accessories.

fashion.Overview: A bright, kitschy style focused on pop culture and '80s/early '90s nostalgia, often layered with toys and accessories.
fashion.title: Decora
fashion.origins: Began in the 1990s in Harajuku, inspired by over-the-top accessories and bright colors.
fashion.styleBasics: Bright colors, plastic hair clips, toy accessories, layered outfits.

fashion.Overview: A substyle of Lolita with a more muted color palette and a focus on historical accuracy.
fashion.title: Classic Lolita
fashion.origins: Developed as a more mature form of Lolita in the 2000s, focusing on historical and vintage-inspired aesthetics.
fashion.styleBasics: Muted colors, long skirts, lace gloves, vintage accessories.

fashion.Overview: A style inspired by old European and aristocratic fashion, often featuring ruffled shirts and elegant long coats.
fashion.title: Aristocrat
fashion.origins: Inspired by Victorian and Gothic fashion in the 1990s as an extension of the Lolita movement.
fashion.styleBasics: Long coats, high collars, ruffled shirts, dark colors.

fashion.Overview: A heavily DIY fashion with a punk edge, often using patches, studs, and torn fabrics to create an anarchy-inspired look.
fashion.title: Punk Kei
fashion.origins: Inspired by Western punk culture in the 1980s and adapted into Japanese street fashion.
fashion.styleBasics: Plaid skirts, leather jackets, spikes, torn fabrics.

fashion.Overview: A mature and chic version of Lolita with a focus on darker tones, such as deep reds, blacks, and jewel tones.
fashion.title: Kuro Lolita
fashion.origins: Emerged as a substyle of Lolita in the 2000s, focusing on gothic and elegant aesthetics.
fashion.styleBasics: Black dresses, lace, corsets, dark makeup.

fashion.Overview: A quirky and whimsical fashion style often inspired by retro and vintage Western fashions, with a playful twist.
fashion.title: Otome Kei
fashion.origins: Popularized in the 1980s, drawing inspiration from retro, girlish, and vintage fashion.
fashion.styleBasics: Bold prints, cardigans, vintage-inspired dresses, quirky accessories.

fashion.Overview: A military-inspired fashion that mixes historical elements with modern Japanese streetwear, creating structured looks.
fashion.title: Military Lolita
fashion.origins: Emerged in the 2000s, blending Lolita fashion with military-inspired details.
fashion.styleBasics: Structured coats, epaulettes, brass buttons, boots.

fashion.Overview: A dark, melancholic style often associated with emotional themes, incorporating a mix of kawaii (cute) and yami (dark) aesthetics.
fashion.title: Jirai Kei
fashion.origins: Became popular in the late 2010s on Japanese social media, often linked to emotional or 'dangerous' aesthetics, with the name loosely translating to 'landmine-style.'
fashion.styleBasics: Soft, pastel-colored outfits paired with darker makeup, chokers, oversized sweaters, short skirts, and layered accessories, creating a vulnerable and melancholic look.
